subject: Re: [junit] [Fwd: Re: Check class file for annotation]
msgSnippet: And speaking of testing private methods, I just came across this: http://erik.thauvin.net/blog/news.jsp?date=2006-01-29#418 -- Cedric ... -- Cédric [Non-text
messageBody:
And speaking of testing private methods, I just came across this:

http://erik.thauvin.net/blog/news.jsp?date=2006-01-29#418

--
Cedric


On 1/29/06, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> On 1/29/06, Andrew McDonagh <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Just came across this post on comp.lang.java.programmer...
> >
> > Does anyone here ever go to this length of trouble to test private
> > stuff?
>
>
> It seems to be overkill. setAccessible() is usually enough to test
> private methods. I'm really not sure the poster understands what apt does
> and I don't see the point in a special annotation for this either...
>
> --
> Cédric
>



--
Cédric
